entry.question: Explain the difference between block and inline elements in HTML.
entry.example_answer: Block elements start on new lines and take full width (div, p); inline elements flow within lines and take only required width (span, a). CSS display controls layout.

entry.question: What is the virtual DOM and why do frameworks use it?
entry.example_answer: Virtual DOM is an in-memory UI representation. Frameworks diff VDOMs to compute minimal real DOM updates, improving performance for many changes.

entry.question: How do you make a web app responsive?
entry.example_answer: Use responsive CSS (flexbox/grid), media queries for breakpoints, fluid units, and responsive images (srcset) to adapt layouts.

medium.question: How do you optimize frontend performance for initial page load?
medium.example_answer: Inline critical CSS, defer non-critical JS, use code splitting and lazy loading, compress assets, serve static via CDN, and cache aggressively to improve first meaningful paint.

medium.question: Explain accessibility best practices for web interfaces.
medium.example_answer: Use semantic HTML and ARIA where needed, ensure keyboard navigation and screen reader compatibility, provide alt text and maintain color contrast for accessibility.

senior.question: Design a strategy to migrate a large legacy frontend to a modern framework with minimal disruption.
senior.example_answer: Use incremental migration (microfrontends or adapters), migrate feature-by-feature, ensure thorough E2E/regression testing and feature flags to reduce user impact.

senior.question: How would you structure state management in a large SPA worked on by multiple teams?
senior.example_answer: Use bounded contexts, local UI state per component, a global store for cross-cutting concerns via clear APIs, favor event-driven communication and document patterns across teams.
